text.tspan: After the first 44 bytes (header) of the WAV file is discarded,
the STM32 fills the entire audio buffer with data from the
WAV file:
Color Code for
Array Status
Standby (with data)
Written from audio file data
Used by DMA (to be sent to Timer 1)
The array is split in half, as each half is operated
seperatly on.
Everytime the audio is read from, the FATFS
library internally increment where we are in the
file, so everytime the file is read, only new data
is returned by the FATFS library.
Then, Timer 4 is enabled, starting the DMA Channel 7's data
transfer from the audio buffer to Timer 1. It starts out with
first half of the buffer:
When the half-transfer interupt in triggered, the DMA moves
on to the second half of the buffer. During this time, the first
half is updated with data from the audio file:
When the full-transfer interupt in triggered, because the DMA
channel is in circular mode, it moves on back to the first half
of the bufffer. During this time, the interupt routine updates
the already sent out second half of the buffer:
The cycle then rinses and repeats until all of the audio file
is sent out.
